conclusion: Mass of child = 30 kg, Mass of sled = 10 kg, Applied force = 100 N at 37° above horizontal, Constant speed (acceleration = 0), sin(37°) = 0.6, cos(37°) = 0.8, g = 10 m/s²

premise: Mass of child = 30 kg, Mass of sled = 10 kg
conclusion: Total mass = mass of child + mass of sled = 30 kg + 10 kg = 40 kg
Weight = mass × g = 40 kg × 10 m/s² = 400 N
Horizontal component: F_x = F × cos(37°) = 100 N × 0.8 = 80 N
Vertical component: F_y = F × sin(37°) = 100 N × 0.6 = 60 N

premise: Vertical forces: Normal force (N) from ground + Vertical component of applied force (F_y), Downward forces: Weight of the system, F_y = 60 N, Weight = 400 N
conclusion: In equilibrium: N + F_y = Weight, N + 60 N = 400 N, N = 400 N - 60 N = 340 N

premise: Horizontal forces at constant speed: Force applied horizontally (F_x) = Friction force, F_x = 80 N
Normal force exerted by the sled on the ground = 340 N
conclusion: The magnitude of the force exerted by the sled on the ground is 340 N.
